22072.title: Landscape with Still Life Arrangement
22072.creation_notes: Notes from Leslie Anderson-Perkins, Curatorial Assistant: The painting was certainly completed after 1932, when he relocated to Falls Village and shifted his focus to landscape painting. In his later career, Dines combined his passion for landscape painting with his talent for still life painting in works like this one. In terms of style, this painting is easily situated in the second half of his career.
22072.credit_line: James E. Roberts Fund, Mr. and Mrs. Julius F. Pratt Fund

Chrysler, 1967; Private Collection, New York, New York; Anonymous Donor (see Registrar Notes), Indianapolis, Indiana; given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 1992.
36600.exhibit_history: FOR EXHIBITIONS AND ROTATIONS DISPLAYED ON SITE AT THE IMA OR ON TOUR BY THE IMA, SEE THE EVENTS TAB: Elvehjem Museum of Art, University of Wisconsin- Madison (since 2005 known as Chazen Museum of Art), Paris 1900: “The American School” at the Universal Exposition, 09/16/2000-12/03/2000  |  Columbus Museum of Art, Columbus, Ohio, Paris 1900: “The American School” at the Universal Exposition, 05/18/2000-08/13/2000  |  Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Paris 1900: “The American School” at the Universal Exposition, 02/11/2000-04/16/2000  |  Montclair Art Museum, Montclair, New Jersey, Paris 1900: “The American School” at the Universal Exposition, 08/18/1999-01/16/2000
